results.title: Elements of survival. Part 1. Populations
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Doug Lower
results.brief_description: First of a two-part series this episode focuses on the population spiral and looks at mankind from pre-history to the present explosion with its doubling of world population about every 35 years. The film looks at the possible consequences of unchecked growth, and the wide gulf between the haves and the have-nots.

results.title: Elements of electrical circuits
results.creator_credit: ERPI Classroom Films and Morris Meisner
results.brief_description: Reveals the nature of electric currents and circuits, electron motions, conductors, insulators, and factors affecting resistance are a few of the subjects explained through animated drawings and photographic demonstrations.

results.title: Elements
results.brief_description: This program tracks the journey of Western Australia’s natural gas from the North Rankin “A” Gas and Condensate production platform, through its 134 km journey to the Burrup Peninsula and through the liquefication process, concluding with delivery to Japan. The video explains various elements of the LNG plant including the sulfinol column, dehydration unit, scrub column, heat exchanger, storage tanks and control room. The program concludes with details of the LNG ships and their delivery of LNG to Japanese power utilities.

results.title: Elementary mathematics for teachers and students: games
results.creator_credit: General Learning Corporation and Davidson Films
results.brief_description: An animated film for in-service work and the classroom. Two strategy games are played, one of co-ordinates, the second where two players take turns to erase a specified number of marks. Once the children have learnt these games they can progress to other games related to “rim”, eg games that use matches, or boardgames with counters. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Elementary experiments in the chemistry of water
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following elementary experiments which illustrate the chemistry of water. 1. Exploding one part of oxygen with two parts of hydrogen to form water. 2. Passing an electric current through pure water and salt solution. 3. Burning hydrogen to form water vapour. 4. Electrolysis of water.

results.title: Elementary electricity
results.creator_credit: National Geographic Society and Roger Brown
results.brief_description: This video begins with a look at the discoveries of Benjamin Franklin and other early inventors who investigated electricity. Students also learn how Edison and his team relied on the basic principles of electricity in their quest to create a practical incandescent light. The video introduces the concepts of current, conductivity, circuits and magnetism. It also looks at modern electric power systems and how they are based on many of Edison’s ideas. Narrated by Gene Galusha.

results.title: Element 3
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Andre Belleau and Jacques Giraldeau
results.brief_description: Made in 1965 to support UNESCO’s campaign for water conservation, this film explores the beauty of this so vulnerable resource and shows how quickly it is dwindling through needless waste, especially in countries best endowed with it. In Egypt the film shows how hard it is to come by water, even today when, within sight of laborious water wheels, a great dam rises. But abused or not, water has extraordinary beauty - in the Zuider Zee, the Rhine, the Volga, the Mississippi, the St. Lawrence, and a hundred other streams shown in this film. (Awards: Rome; Toronto; Salerno.)

results.title: Elektra: a tragedy in one act
results.brief_description: Clytemnestra, Queen of Thebes, has murdered her husband with the help of her lover Aegisthus. Electra, her daughter, has taken her younger brother Orestes to safety in a foreign country where he is being raised to avenge his father. Whilst the palace residents (including Chrysothemis, Electra’s sister) have come to terms with the new situation, Electra keeps the memory of her father’s murder alive, waiting for the day of retribution. Hugo von Hofmannsthal’s opera is based on Sophocles’s Electra, with music by Richard Strauss magnificently performed by Leonie Rysanek (Elektra), Astrid Varnay (Clytemnestra), Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau (Orestes) and members of the Konzertvereinigung Wiener Staatsopernchor. Karl Bohm conducts the Wiener Philharmoniker. Sung in German. A booklet containing a synopsis is included.

results.title: Elegant girl or the drive for reliability
results.brief_description: A musical advertisement for the Vauxhall motor car. Makes a technical comparison between vintage and later model cars and shows the detailed testing the modern Vauxhall goes through to ensure its all-round quality and performance is at a maxiumum.
